lead_paragraph: SLAVEN--Seymour, born August 13, 1923, died peacefully Sunday, May 8, 2016. Beloved husband of Marie Yvonne, father of Steven (Marcy), Arthur (Jane), the late Nadine Slaven, and Catherine Kohn (Adam); grandfather of Nicole Kaufmann, Stacee Silver Behar, David Slaven, Michael Slaven, Carly Silver Pearson, and Peter Slaven; great-grandfather of Sophya, Sasha, Sydney, Yoshua, Sloane, Charlotte and Anthony. Born in Brooklyn, New York, he attended Boys High School and served his country in the U.S. Army Air Corps during the Second World War. At the age of 25 he moved his family to Ponce, Puerto Rico, where he built a business, Ponce Pearl Corp., and in a few years became a pillar of the community. He was a founder of The Caribbean School and taught Spanish at the Catholic University. In 1963 he moved to Sands Point, New York. He headed Dickard Widder Industries until 1994 when he moved to Boca Raton, Florida. A renaissance man who lived life with great enthusiasm, he was a raconteur known for his sharp whit and great sense of humor. He was a respected businessman and advisor, spoke four languages, and was an avid reader. He played and enjoyed many sports and was an accomplished Bridge player. He was dearly loved by his family and friends and his memory will be forever cherished. Donations in his memory may be made to American Foundation for Suicide Prevention. Funeral services Wednesday, May 11, 2016, 2:30pm at B'nai Israel, 2200 Yamato Road, Boca Raton, FL. 1/3
